main.name: Scott Harvey
main.description:
I've spent most of my career creating ColdFusion applications that integrate JavaScript, HTML, and CSS front ends with MS SQL Server or Oracle databases.

I certified as a full stack JavaScript developer in 2020, and I am comfortable with its many forms, including Vanilla, Node (ExpressJS), and React (NextJS).
main.bio:
Outside of work I value spending time with friends, cooking, and traveling with my partner. I feel very fortunate to have traveled to about 30 countries on 6 continents!

Professionally, I value a sense of ownership and working on projects that make a difference. The position that I recall most fondly was at CLR where I built an intranet from the ground up, automating many time-consuming processes. I felt great pride each time a coworker told me how much time and work these automations saved them. And, like a lot of developers, I also appreciate times when I can put my head down and write code.

Technology changes rapidly, so I strive to keep learning. In early 2020, I completed a Full Stack Developer certification using the MERN stack to update my skills and stay competitive. In the bootcamp, I most enjoyed developing RESTful APIs using Node.js, Express, and MongoDB and strengthening my front end development skills by adding React, Bootstrap, and responsive CSS to my repertoire. I've also recently learned Ruby, Jekyll, Liquid Templates, and the US Web Design System.

I am actively looking for a full time position where I can keep learning and dedicate my time to an organization I care about. I’m currently freelancing on various projects using NextJS, VueJS, MS SQL, HTML, and CSS.

skills.skillmessage: Here are some of the skills I've picked up along the way:

bootcampProjects.title: To-do List v2 (with Login)
bootcampProjects.overlayText: The React app 'To-Do v1' with an RESTful Express API back-end. Express uses Mongoose to interface with MongoDB in order to save to-do items.
bootcampProjects.assignment: Build upon the previous to-do application by adding a login and writing the to-do items to MongoDB.
bootcampProjects.solution:
Added an Express back-end to To-Do v1. Express serves as an RESTful API and it uses Mongoose to interface with MongoDB in order to save to-do items.

Used help from Build a Login/Auth App with the MERN Stack and How to take advantage of Local Storage in your React projects for authentication and session management.
bootcampProjects.technology: MERN (MongoDB (Mongoose), Express, React, NodeJS), React Bootstrap, and React Simple Storage

bootcampProjects.title: Cars v2
bootcampProjects.overlayText: A React app with an RESTful Express API for a simplified version of an inventory tracker for an automobile dealership.
bootcampProjects.assignment: Create a full stack web application that uses a MongoDB collection to store a collection about cars in an inventory. Create the back-end of the application using Express and the front-end using React.
bootcampProjects.solution: Used Express to build an RESTful API that serves as the back-end for a React front-end that is a simplified version of an inventory tracker for an automobile dealership. The API uses Mongoose to interface with MongoDB in order to save cars to the inventory. The React front-end was bootstrapped using create-react-app.
bootcampProjects.technology: MERN (MongoDB (Mongoose), Express, React, NodeJS) and React Bootstrap

bootcampProjects.title: Currency Converter / Three Card Monte
bootcampProjects.overlayText: A React app that allows the user to choose between a currency converter and a Three-card Monte game.
bootcampProjects.assignment:
Create an app that allows the user to choose between a currency converter and a Three-card Monte game.

Converter: The user should be able to enter a number of dollars, which the app calculates and displays in Rands, Pounds, and Euros. Components displaying converted values should be children of the conversion component.

Game: The user should be shown 3 ‘Cards’. When clicked, they 'turn' to reveal a won or lost message. The player can then ‘Try again’ or ‘Quit’. The winning card should be different each time.
bootcampProjects.solution: Used create-react-app to bootstrap a React app. Exchange rates are fetched from https://apilayer.com/. The game fulfills requirements and notes winning or losing streaks.

features.feature: Custom feedback for winning / losing streaks

bootcampProjects.title: Current Weather
bootcampProjects.overlayText: A React app that displays the current weather in the city of the user's choice.
bootcampProjects.assignment: Create a React app that will display the weather in a city of the user’s choice. The user should be able to enter or select the name of the city that they would like to see the weather for. The app should get the weather by fetching the OpenWeatherMap API
bootcampProjects.solution:
Used create-react-app to bootstrap a React app that displays the current weather in the city of the user's choice by fetching it from the OpenWeatherMap API.

The app adds the user's previous choices to a selector that triggers a fresh API call to the OpenWeatherMap API.

In order to improve on the assigned project I also used the Google Maps API to fetch and auto-suggest names of cities as the user types.

features.feature: Uses APIs to autosuggest cities and get weather

bootcampProjects.title: Connect Four
bootcampProjects.assignment: Create a simple game (other than Tic-Tac-Toe) using React.
bootcampProjects.solution: Used create-react-app to bootstrap a React game of Connect Four.

bootcampProjects.title: To-do List v1
bootcampProjects.solution: Used create-react-app to bootstrap a React to-do list that allows the user to add / delete items from a list and has admin users that can see other users' lists.

bootcampProjects.title: Using an API
bootcampProjects.overlayText: Used NextJS to fetch data from the Star Wars API and React to create a list / drilldown style app for Star Wars characters.
bootcampProjects.assignment: Use NextJS to build a dynamic website that uses data retrieved from an API.
bootcampProjects.solution: Used NextJS to fetch data from the Star Wars API and React to create a list / drilldown style app. The app displays 5 random character names that drill down to character details.

bootcampProjects.title: Calculator
bootcampProjects.solution: Used create-react-app to bootstrap a React calculator.

bootcampProjects.title: Guitarist Center v2
bootcampProjects.overlayText: Used a previous project for an online guitar store and added a functional shopping cart that meets the requirements.
bootcampProjects.assignment: Make an online store with a functional shopping cart and a checkout process that can accept a discount code.
bootcampProjects.solution: Used a previous project for an online guitar store and added a functional shopping cart that meets the requirements.
bootcampProjects.technology: sessionStorage for shopping cart persistence, Bootstrap 4, HTML, and JavaScript.

bootcampProjects.title: Guitarist Center v3
bootcampProjects.solution: Used create-react-app to bootstrap a React guitar store.
bootcampProjects.technology: localStorage for shopping cart persistence, React, React Bootstrap, jQuery, and jQueryUI

bootcampProjects.title: Restaurant POS
bootcampProjects.overlayText: An ordering system for a restaurant.
bootcampProjects.assignment: Create an ordering system that would be used by wait staff to submit orders to the bar and kitchen.
bootcampProjects.solution: Used bootstrap and HTML to create an ordering system for a restaurant.

bootcampProjects.solution: A simple page that shows various car models and shows the description of the car when clicked.
